intro: Dasylirion texanum, commonly known as the Texas sotol, is a perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of long, narrow, blue-green leaves. The plant produces a tall, branched flowering stalk that bears small, white to pale purple flowers. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its hardy nature and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
